title: Report: Tannehill replaces Mariota as Titans QB
text:
Tennessee Titans quarterback Marcus Mariota will be benched in favor of Ryan Tannehill for Sunday's game against the Los Angeles Chargers in Nashville, NFL Network reported Tuesday.

Tannehill replaced Mariota during last week's 16-0 loss at Denver that dropped the Titans to 2-4.

Mariota was lifted midway through the third quarter after throwing his second interception of the game and season. He exited after completing 7 of 18 passes for 63 yards.

Tannehill was 13 of 16 for 144 yards and an interception.

Mariota, the second overall pick of the 2015 NFL Draft, has completed 94 of 159 passes (59.1 percent) for 1,179 yards with seven touchdowns this season. The 9.5 passer rating against Denver was the worst of his career.

Tannehill started every game for the Miami Dolphins in his first four seasons (2012-15). He was limited to 24 games the past three years -- missing the entire 2017 season due to a torn ACL -- with injuries. He was traded to Tennessee in March.

Tennessee has scored 17 points or less in four of the past five games and seven or less in three of its last four games.

--Field Level Media
